message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with clustering words in a literary text, which is a natural language processing (NLP) task. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses a greedy agglomerative procedure to minimize projection entropy, which is a measure of segmentedness of an element set. This makes it relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves feature allocation, which is a combinatorial object, making it relevant to sub-categories such as cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper involves text analysis, which is relevant to sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
